title: Microlearning Based on Multi-Stage Social-Occupational Integrated Assessment for Diagnosing and Correcting Cardiovascular Physiology Misconceptions

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in high-level project execution, understanding of organizational communication protocols, and basic social structure analysis skills related to job responsibilities
context.additional_context: Conducted via smartphone-based learning in limited-technology environments, with case-centered education considering job relevance. Offers customized content based on learners’ organizational roles (citizen, leader, follower) and emphasizes communication strategies considering cultural contexts.

learning_goals: Learners will diagnose misconceptions in cardiovascular physiology with ≥80% accuracy and apply these to organizational knowledge-sharing processes.
Learners will improve metacognitive awareness of their knowledge levels by ≥50% through multi-stage assessments and perform self-reflection using peer feedback systems.

In a 4-week project-based assessment, learners will analyze ≥2/3 presented misconceptions (e.g., workflow misunderstandings, data interpretation errors, communication biases) applied to real work scenarios (meetings, reports, decisions) and receive ≥4/5 points in "applicability" from ≥2/3 supervisors/peers. Additionally, cultural diversity considerations will be incorporated into team collaboration.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
